contents: Article 32 (Carryover of Budget) ① The expenditure budget of each fiscal year cannot be carried over to the next year. However, the amount of expenses that fall under any of the following items may be carried over to the next fiscal year and used. 1. Due to the nature of the expenses, it is predicted that the expenses will not be completed within the year, so this purpose must be specified in the budget and submitted to the board of directors in advance. 2. If the approval of the Board of Directors is obtained for expenses that were not spent within the year due to unavoidable reasons after an act causing the expenditure was performed within the year, and incidental expenses for which the act causing the expenditure was not performed, ② Notwithstanding the provisions of paragraph 1 Among the annual amount of continuing expenses, the amount not spent in the current year can be carried forward and used until the year of completion of the relevant continuing expense project. ③ When the budget is carried over in accordance with paragraphs 1 and 2, a carry-over statement is prepared. This must be reported without delay to the Minister of Strategy and Finance, the Minister of Health and Welfare, and the Board of Audit and Inspection., [Fully revised on December 23, 2008]
